value.title: Join us! Thursday July 9, 2020 at 11:00 AM – 12:00 noon PDT with Reza Rad!
value.excerpt: Building a data model in Power BI is the most important task you should do properly in your Power BI solution. This session is about the most common design pattern models of Power BI; Building the Star Schema with fact table and dimension tables, understand the relationships, building common models such

images.title: Join us! Thursday July 9, 2020 at 11:00 AM – 12:00 noon PDT with Reza Rad!

value.title: Join us! Wednesday July 8, 2020 at 11:00 AM – 12:00 noon PDT with Reid Havens!
value.excerpt: In this Power BI webinar Reid Havens covers two of the cornerstones of Power Query, tuning and designing for optimal refresh speeds, and intelligently handling errors.

images.title: Join us! Wednesday July 8, 2020 at 11:00 AM – 12:00 noon PDT with Reid Havens!

value.title: New capabilities for the Power BI Snowflake connector are now generally available
value.excerpt: Enhanced capabilities to the Snowflake connector for Power BI were added a while back, including support for Azure Active Directory authentication, and more. These are now generally available.

images.title: New capabilities for the Power BI Snowflake connector are now generally available

value.title: Ideas.PowerBI.com – Azure Active Directory Single Sign On is Here!

value.title: Announcing General Availability (GA) of enhanced connectivity for Snowflake
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce the that the enhanced capabilities added recently to the Power BI Snowflake connector are now GA, including the ability to connect to Snowflake without an on-premises data gateway as well as support for Azure Active Directory (AAD) authentication and SSO in DirectQuery mode

images.title: Announcing General Availability (GA) of enhanced connectivity for Snowflake

value.title: The theme you᾿ve been waiting for – Dark mode comes to the Power BI iOS app
value.excerpt: In this week’s release we’ve added dark mode support to the Power BI iOS app. Power BI Mobile users know that we’re always working to improve our apps and looking for ways to provide our users the best, most delightful, and enjoyable experience possible. And enabling dark mode is one of those things

images.title: The theme you᾿ve been waiting for – Dark mode comes to the Power BI iOS app

value.title: Power BI for iOS gets updated with dark mode support
value.excerpt: The Power BI app for iOS has received a new update. The latest update adds support for dark mode to the app. Earlier, Microsoft noted that it will add dark mode to Power BI mobile apps in June 2020.

images.title: Power BI for iOS gets updated with dark mode support

value.title: Roadmap update: What᾿s next for the new workspace experience upgrade in the coming months

value.title: Power BI Dataflows Direct Query Support
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce Direct Query support (Preview) for Power BI dataflows.  You can now connect directly to a dataflow without first requiring to import the data into a dataset.

images.title: Power BI Dataflows Direct Query Support

value.title: Power BI Report Server May 2020 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: We are excited to bring you a new version of Power BI Report Server this month! With this update, we’re releasing a bevy of features across all aspects of Power BI: hierarchical slicer and decomposition tree visuals, query diagnostics, and more. Read on to get the full details of all the new additions!

images.title: Power BI Report Server May 2020 Feature Summary
